snippet: The military response from the American-led coalition has been relatively limited since Monday when the Taliban seized Kunduz, the first city taken by the insurgents since 2001.
abstract: Taliban’s occupation of Kunduz, Afghanistan, first city taken by insurgents since 2001, has United States officials developing plans to help Afghan forces, currently holding out at city’s airport with some American and German trainers; fall of Kunduz raises questions on American withdrawal plans and readiness of Afghan troops.
lead_paragraph: The military response from the American-led coalition has been relatively limited since Monday when the Taliban seized Kunduz, the first city taken by the insurgents since 2001.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Struggles for Way to Help Afghans Regain Territory It Thought Was Secure
headline.main: U.S. Struggles for Way to Help Afghans Regain Territory It Thought Was Secure

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
